msItem.title: Les aprises Salamon
msItem.rubric: Ces sunt les aprises Salamon li sages, quii enseyna a ses amys
msItem.bibl: Dean and Boulton 262; this ms. only; unpr.

msItem.note: Prayers to be said at the time of Mass, in French and Latin prose.

msItem.title: Les peines de purgatorie
msItem.note: A 'compeleysun' or 'sarmon de purgatorie'. Leaf wanting after fol. 16, at least one leaf wanting after fol. 28: at fol. 24r is an English sentence.

listBibl.bibl: ed. and tr. Hunt and Bliss (2010), 393-421 (based on MS. Bodl. 654 with variants from the present ms.)

msItem.title: Prayers
msItem.incipit: Duz Deus, duz Peres, e Seynt Trinite
msItem.note: After a short discourse come thirty prayers to Christ and to the Virgin: a leaf is missing after fol. 29.

listBibl.bibl: Dean and Boulton, nos. 851 (Seven Requests, fols. 30-33), 766 (15 [here 13] Joys of the Virgin, fols. 33-36, = Sonet 458), 731 (Elevation prayer, fol. 35 (?)), 893 (7 Aves, fols. 37-8).
ed. and tr. Hunt and Bliss (2010), 149-153 (fols. 33-36)

msItem.title: On the seven sacraments
msItem.incipit: Bapteme fet le alme necte de tuz pechez. Cest sacrement ne poest nul receyuere
msItem.note: Not listed as a separate text in Dean and Boulton (but cf. 666 (?)). Also (fragmentary) in Brussels, Bibliothèque royale de Belgique, IV 00852 (see http://jonas.irht.cnrs.fr/oeuvre/22684 [1 Oct. 2024]).

msItem.title: On penance

listBibl.bibl: Dean and Boulton 672, not listing the present manuscript
ed. and tr. Hunt and Bliss (2010), 294-319, not listing the present manuscript

msItem.note: Begins imperfect at 'frez mie de co penitence' (Hunt and Bliss, p. 300 l. 14) and ends 'e orez e issi ditez', cf. ibid., p. 312, the text here varying; pp. 306-310 omitted in this version.

msItem.title: On the seven deadly sins.
msItem.incipit: Set mortel peches sunt orgeyl envye

listBibl.bibl: ed. and tr. Hunt and Bliss (2010), 277-285, from MS. Rawl. C. 46
Cf. Dean and Boulton 666, not listing the present manuscript.

msItem.note: Also (fragmentary) in Brussels, Bibliothèque royale de Belgique, IV 00852 (see http://jonas.irht.cnrs.fr/oeuvre/22684 [1 Oct. 2024]).

msItem.title: De infantia saluatoris (Gospel of Ps.-Matthew)
msItem.note: (Anglo-Norman version of a Continental French translation)

A legend of the events preceding the birth of Christ, introducing Joseph, st. Mary the Virgin, Abiachar, Joachim and angels: the first leaf is lost, and the text beg. abruptly, 'estre entre les sacrifices Deu: pur co ke Deu ne tei benesquit tant ke il donast engendrure de Israel'.

listBibl.bibl: ed. and tr. Hunt and Bliss (2010), 129-147, referring to four other Continental manuscripts.
Noted in Dean and Boulton, as part of the entry for 645.

msItem.note: Followed (fols. 72v-73r) by a text on the ten commandments, apparently breaking off incomplete after the third.
msItem.incipit: Dampne deue dona diz comandemens en la ley
